definition: to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]

sentences.english: See the net that is like flourishing swim business also undercurrent is billowy .
sentences.chinese: 看似红火的网游业务也暗潮汹涌。

sentences.english: In the seemingly calm facade ESOP Association is actually surging undercurrent .
sentences.chinese: 在貌似平静的职工持股会外表下面，其实是暗潮涌动。

sentences.english: But who could tame the tide away and tell it where to go?
sentences.chinese: 而谁又能平复暗潮，告诉它何去何从？

sentences.english: Iran is often portrayed as a country with violence 4)brewing just beneath its surface.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗经常被形容为一个暗潮汹涌的地方。

definition: lit. storm clouds approach/troubles lie ahead (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
turbid flow/muddy waters/fig. a contemptible person/fig. corrupt or disgraceful social trends
